Title: Solidarity in the European Union

This project aims to develop a normative model of inter-, trans-, and supra-national solidarity in the context of the European Union (EUSOL1). The model will then be applied to four central issues in the EU: the free movement of persons, burden-sharing in the EU's refugee policy, inter-state transfers, and enlargement and accession (EUSOL2). By providing a normative account of solidarity in the EU, this project will contribute to a deeper understanding of the principles and values that should guide EU policy and decision-making. The project's findings will inform strategies for promoting greater solidarity and cooperation among EU member states, ultimately strengthening the union and promoting the well-being of its citizens.
